newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: SLOVENIA WELCOMES PACT WITH HUNGARY, ITALY.
newsitem.headline: SLOVENIA WELCOMES PACT WITH HUNGARY, ITALY.

text.p: Slovenian Foreign Minister Davorin Kracun on Wednesday welcomed a joint declaration signed with Italy and Hungary and said the agreement would contribute to stability and economic growth in the region.
"The contents of the declaration are in the interest of all three countries," Kracun said on his return from Rome where the agreement was struck.
The joint declaration said Slovenia and Hungary should be among the first to join the eventual expansion of the European Union and the North Atlantic Treaty Organsation (NATO).
It said the countries were "firmly convinced that Europe's future stability and development can only be based upon the final completion of the processes of European and Atlantic integration".
Kracun dismissed reporters' questions about resistance to Slovenia's associate agreement with the EU among some Italian members of the European Parliament.
"We can not evaluate the whole political line of one country by the votes of individual members of parliament," he said.
